links.title: Stop the Mass Slaughter of Street Dogs in India
links.description:
On August 11th, 2025, India’s Supreme Court ordered all stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to be removed from public spaces and locked away in shelters, with no return to their home streets.

Even though a later bench called that “too harsh” and talked about sterilise-vaccinate-return with designated feeding zones, the damage was done. People heard exactly what they wanted to hear: the dogs are the problem, and getting rid of them is acceptable.

Since then, we’ve seen what that looks like on the ground.
Dogs beaten with sticks and iron rods.
Dogs rounded up and dumped in places with no food, water or shelter.
A dog in Jaipur tied by the legs and thrown onto a live transformer, electrocuted to death while his caretaker screamed.

This is state-sanctioned cruelty by silence.

India’s Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act still values a dog’s suffering at ₹10-50 ($0.11-0.56) for a first offence. Even repeat offenders can walk away with a token fine and a few months in jail, if that.

TNVR, trap, neuter, vaccinate, return, works. It reduces bites. It controls rabies. It stabilises street dog populations. But killing, dumping and looking the other way is cheaper in the short term. Once again, money matters more than life.

India loves to sell itself as the land of ahimsa, of compassion for all living beings. Right now, its streets tell a very different story.

India’s tourism industry is projected to pump tens of billions into the economy in 2025. If the government and the courts want to ignore the blood on the pavements, then it’s time to hit them where it hurts most, their wallet.

Cancel the yoga retreats and tiger safaris.
Skip the spiritual “bucket list” tours.
Choose countries that actually enforce cruelty laws.

Until India stops turning its street dogs into punching bags and corpses, it does not deserve your money.

links.title: Stop The Cat and Dog Meat Trade in China
links.summary:
China removed dogs from the national livestock list in 2020. Because there are no national animal welfare laws in China, dogs now have no legal rights.

No food animal status means no food-safety framework, no lawful slaughter rules, and no transport standards, resulting in a black market of stolen pets, back-alley killing, menu fraud, and trucks moving animals across the country in the dark.

A superstitious belief that more pain means better meat, and no binding standards, leads to dogs boiled alive, blowtorched alive, skinned alive, and savagely beaten.

Shenzhen and Zhuhai banned it outright. The rest of the country hasn’t.
So dogs and cats now exist in a loophole: not approved as food, not banned everywhere, which means fewer protections and more suffering.

"It's their culture/tradition" is a copout and ignorance talking. You wouldn't give a free pass to "cultural/traditional" child brides, slavery, or honor killings elsewhere.
China needs a national ban on slaughter, transport, sale, and advertising. Licenses pulled. Markets closed. Raids on supply lines. Public enforcement reports.

links.description2: Stage or prolong suffering → post daily "updates" → guilt-trip → collect via instant-pay links → disappear/recycle content. Use throwaway admins and burner numbers. When flagged, they rename, pivot, or move to a new handle.
links.description3Title: Red flags to look out for
description3: Money first, transparency never: PayPal.me / mobile money / Western Union only; no registered charity number, no audited reports, no vet invoices.
Geo nonsense: Claims "Uganda shelter" while geotags/photos hop across countries or time zones. Stock photos of "Africa" sprinkled in.
High followers, dead engagement: Bought audience; low comments/likes that don’t match follower count.
Recycled media: Same dog, same injury, posted for months with "urgent surgery today!" Reverse-image search catches repeats.
No real-world footprint: No website or a 1-page site with stolen copy; no Google Maps listing; no legitimate adoption process or contracts.
Pressure tactics: "Only YOU can save him in the next hour," mass tagging, DM spamming, guilt trips if you ask for proof.
Vague or shifting details: Dog’s name, age, location, and diagnosis change post to post.
Medical fantasy: Miraculous diagnoses, dramatic before/after collages, never a verifiable vet name, clinic address, or itemized bill.
Comment control: Critical questions deleted, comments turned off, or replies move instantly to DMs.
Verified-but-hijacked look: Sometimes a verified or old account repurposed (handle changed, old content wiped).
Logistics that make no sense: Offering international adoptions but no import/export compliance or quarantine info.
Donation links, zero governance: No trustees, no policy pages (safeguarding, returns, complaints), no annual reports—just the donate button.

links.title: Stop Chinese Cat Torture Rings
links.description:
Our kids are being exposed to extreme animal torture content, cats and kittens abused for entertainment, status, and in some cases, paid commissioning.
Reports claim 43% of 16–17 year olds have witnessed animal cruelty online. A generation is being conditioned to tolerate suffering.

These cruelty rings don’t survive because the internet is “too big to police.”
They survive because the source is allowed to operate, and the content is then exported globally through reuploads and private channels.
As of today, there are zero animal welfare laws in China. In 2006, a comprehensive animal welfare bill was drafted, but the Chinese government refused to move it forward.

Animal cruelty is a known red flag for human violence.
Research into school massacres found 43% of perpetrators had histories of animal cruelty before the attacks.
A study of 150 adult males arrested for animal cruelty/neglect/animal sexual abuse found 96% had other criminal charges in their histories.

Torture content → desensitisation → escalation → harm to people

China must shut these networks down at the source.
Not “investigate.” Not “monitor.” Not “condemn.”
Arrest, prosecute, and dismantle.

And if China refuses to police torture-for-entertainment networks operating inside its borders, then governments across the world need to stop treating this like an awkward cultural footnote and start treating it like what it is:

A cross-border youth harm crisis.

That’s why we are contacting the international embassies in China:

Because this isn’t staying in China.
It’s landing in our kids’ feeds.

links.title: Stop The Mass Slaughter of Street Dogs in Iraq
links.description:
On December 22nd, 2025, Baghdad’s municipality admitted it carried out 1,562 “campaigns” and killed 19,386 stray dogs between Jan 1 and Nov 30, 2025.

Hamzah Barani Shamsheer was bitten in early November 2025 in Baghdad’s Ameriyah area and later died of rabies because he didn't complete the vaccination course. A child is left fatherless because his dad was an idiot.

Iraq’s Health Ministry says rabies vaccines and antiserum are available across health institutions.
So the response to one man's ignorance is collective punishment of an entire species.

Culling doesn’t “fix” street dogs. It just creates a revolving door: new dogs move in, breeding continues, and the killing becomes permanent policy.

Street dogs are a man-made problem. Abandonment creates them. Negligence feeds them. Garbage and lack of enforcement keep them there. Then authorities pretend the dogs are the problem when they become an inconvenience.

Stop the cull. Fund mass dog vaccination and CNVR/TNVR. Make bite treatment and follow-up unavoidable. Fix waste and abandonment.

Location: Bhatwaliya, Ghazipur district, Uttar Pradesh, 233226

This lame captive elephant is being marched down Ghazipur–Kasimabad Road in Bhatwaliya, UP 233226.
His front right leg is visibly injured, possibly from an old fracture that healed incorrectly or severe chronic foot disease.

This is cruelty and negligence in full public view.
We are demanding an urgent investigation, seizure of the elephant, and legal action against the owners and handlers.

Thank you @protect.animals.worldwide for bringing this to our attention.

links.title: Eterazama Dog Abuse
links.description:
Location: Eterazama, Bolivia

A man drags two dogs tied to a rope, one is already dead.
The other, shaking in terror, is forced to walk beside the corpse.

According to locals, this is a recurring event. The abuser, an alcoholic whose identity is yet to be confirmed, gets a puppy, abuses it to death, and then gets another one.

links.title: Puppy Neglect In Lewisville, TX
links.description:
This poor puppy is shut out day and night. Sometimes there's a crate, sometimes there isn't. He's had no protection from the recent storms in the area.
Under Texas Penal Code §42.092, this appears to meet the definition of:
- Unreasonably failing to provide necessary shelter and care for an animal in one’s custody (§42.092(b)(3)); and
- Confining an animal in a cruel manner (§42.092(b)(5)).
The owner claims they work 12-hour shifts and “has to” shut the puppy out or he will soil the house. And yet the puppy is shut out with no shelter, whilst the owner is home.
Animal services have been called, but aren't taking the situation seriously. Forecasts in Lewisville expect temperatures of 30°F next week, cold enough to cause severe illness or death if he's shut out without shelter.

links.title: Protect Abused and Neglected Dogs on Skid Row
links.description:
Luke here survived with third-degree burns and smoke-damaged lungs. The other dog is still lying dead on Florence Ave. nearly a week later.

People in the encampment are claiming Luke “got a fright and jumped into the fire.” Bullshit. Dogs don’t “accidentally” swan-dive into flames. Someone lit that fire, and then they refused to give him up for treatment.
@compton_paw_patrol pulled Luke out of the camp and got him to a vet.

If you're interested in being Luke's foster once he's out of the vet, DM @compton_paw_patrol

And please consider donating to @compton_paw_patrol. Vet treatment isn't cheap.

Thank you, @therealpaulmueller, for sharing his story.

links.title: Demand An Investigation Into Georgie's Injuries
links.description:
Georgie was adopted from Ardmore Animal Shelter. Two weeks later, he was found wandering the streets of Ardmore with second-degree burns on his head, neck, legs, and paw pads, which are believed to be intentionally inflicted. @ntxaussie took him in and gave him a second chance at life. However, his adopted owner, Isaiah Nugent, has refused to answer questions from Ardmore Animal Shelter and has not been investigated.

Thank you, @ntxaussie, for giving Georgie a fighting chance.
And thank you, @therealpaulmueller for bringing this to our attention.

links.title: Demand Animal Welfare Laws in Vietnam
links.description: There are currently no comprehensive animal welfare laws in Vietnam. Any protections animals have are flimsy at best and nestled into other legislation, leaving plenty of wiggle room for loopholes to be exploited. Due to these exploits, dogs and cats are stolen from the streets to be slaughtered in deplorable conditions with no legal consequences. A ban on dog meat has been in effect in Hanoi since 2021, but there is no national ban yet, despite 64% of Vietnamese people supporting one.

links.title: Stop Bronx Cat Killer
links.description: Potential location: 244 E 198th St, Apt 6E, Bronx NY 10458, and sometimes at Williamsbridge Oval Skate Park. A 'man' known only as “David”, who tortured and killed a cat, then posted it to Instagram for entertainment. His page @churchofububal has since been deleted, but the YouTube channel under the same name remains active. He has now threatened to kill another animal on October 31. He is believed to be around 27, with a left-side neck tattoo, a Spider-Man tattoo on his right rib, and another on his right hand. This is mental illness.

links.title: Dog Run Over & Killed In Dallas, TX
links.description:
Appeal for information.
On October 9, 2025, on the 11200 block of Balch Springs Road at roughly 7:30 A.M. A red Dodge pickup ran over a dog in the street, reversed, and ran the dog over again, painting a clear image of intent.

"Cruelty is whenever you turn the wheel intentionally, and you hit the dog for a second time,"

Balch Springs police and animal services have located the red Dodge truck, but they still need tips that can lead them to the driver.

The dog, unfortunately, did not make it 💔

phones.who: Balch Springs Animal Services Supervisor Chelsie Way

links.title: Justice For Aria
links.description: Aria was a 12-year-old Maltese-Shih Tzu. On August 29 2025, while her family was on vacation, she died under the care of Rover sitter Barbara Paz in Miami. She said she “passed peacefully in her sleep.” Aria’s eye was protruding from the socket, and her scalp separated from her skull,and she was cremated without consent to destroy the evidence.
